summary: This is a joint notice filed in the United States District Court for the Southern District of Florida, indicating that the plaintiff and defendants Jeffrey Epstein and Sarah Kellen have resolved the civil action (Case No. 08-CIV-80811-MARRA/JOHNSON). The parties stipulate that all pending motions are moot and will file a stipulation of dismissal with prejudice upon finalizing the settlement documents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named defendant in the civil lawsuit that has been resolved through settlement.

persons.context: Named defendant alongside Jeffrey Epstein in the civil lawsuit that has been resolved through settlement.

connections.description: Both are named as defendants in the same civil lawsuit that was resolved by settlement.
Robert D. Critton, Jr. is listed as counsel for defendant Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Filing of Joint Notice of Resolution/Settlement
events.description: The plaintiff and defendants file a joint notice to the court stating they have resolved the civil action and will file a stipulation of dismissal with prejudice.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of Florida
keyFacts: A civil lawsuit (Case No. 08-CIV-80811-MARRA/JOHNSON) against Jeffrey Epstein and Sarah Kellen was resolved by settlement in December 2009.
The parties agreed to file a stipulation of dismissal with prejudice, indicating a final resolution of the claims.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17), suggesting confidentiality around certain settlement terms.
Attorney Robert D. Critton, Jr. represented Jeffrey Epstein in this matter.
The case was pending in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Florida.
